subject: Re: [junit] Creating logs
msgSnippet: ... System.out.println( ) only prints an empty line, so it probably /looks/ like it s doing nothing. As for your problem, that depends on your web container.
messageBody:
prachi_qa wrote:

> Hi,
> I am using HTTPUnit for unit testing of some of my web applications.
> Currently any comment I write using System.out.println("")is not
> visible when any of my Junit tests pass. I would like to create some
> sort of log for printing these messages. Can u pls guide me how can
> it be done.

System.out.println("") only prints an empty line, so it probably /looks/
like it's doing nothing.

As for your problem, that depends on your web container. Wherever
"standard out" or "system out" goes (file? console?), so goes the output
from System.out.print() and println(). Read your web container
documentation for details.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
